item.title: Report E-2025050539
item.description:
Report E-2025050539

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-27
  • City: CHINA GROVE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 27, 2025, fourteen (14) 5-gallon pails of printing ink were damaged due to a load shift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Carolina Environmental Response Team, Inc. (CERT) to remediate the site. Prior to their arrival, RLC personnel transferred the freight to the dock and the trailer was placed back in service. CERT personnel collected the damaged pails and containerized them in four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: SHELBY
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE BOX WAS DISCOVERED DURING THE UNLOAD PHASE. THE OUTSIDE OF THE PKG WAS WET. IT WAS PLACED IN THE DMP ARE IN A SPILL TRAY. IDENTIFIED THE CONTENTS, FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE TO SELECT THE APROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET (FLAMMABLE LIQUID). USING THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, CLEANED UP THE SPILL, DECONTAMINATED THE EQUIPMENT, AND COMPLETED THE HAZMAT/DAMAGE REPORT.

item.title: Report E-2025050502
item.description:
Report E-2025050502

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: FAISON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 180000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling eastbound on I 40 near Faison, North Carolina. Another vehicle was improperly backing on the highway and was struck by the KAG Energy, LLC unit. Following impact, the KAG Energy, LLC unit went off the roadway and rolled over. Approximately 4700 gallons of fuel was released. A majority of the spilled gasoline was consumed in a fire that ignited following the accident. Eastern Environmental responded to the scene and is handling the remediation.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 2 loads of undeclared hazmat shipped/received. Shipper site inadvertently and unknowingly mixed petroleum contact water containing gasoline with other wastewaters. Material was shipped as non-hazardous material for recovery. Nominal Flammable layer discovered on receipt. Materials safely managed.
